areaDesc.3: Suburban atmosphere. A modest development fair character. Near employment
areaDesc.14: Developed by G. E. during war time. Outside the city limits of Erie. This section has concentration of row houses with from 6 to 10 units in a group. Sales of these units have been very good in early 1937.

areaDesc.3: Quiet surburban section of modest character. Fairly new development.
areaDesc.14: Most of this section is outside Erie city limits. These few streets are distinctly newer and better than the remainder of the area.

areaDesc.3: Good Schools and transportation - convenient to shopping area.
areaDesc.14: Section is somewhat spotty with many original owners still living in section. Sales are poor but have improved since early 1937.

areaDesc.3: good transportation
areaDesc.14: A promotion which never took hold. Housing is concentrated south of 23rd Street between Geist and Haybargh Avenues.

areaDesc.3: Good schools and transportation
areaDesc.14: Property south of 26th Street is considered to be more desirable than that on the norht. There is considerable business on the dividing street. Hazel and Maple Streets re not good with foreign coming in. From Myrtle Street to Peach Street south of 26th, properties are below par of the section.

areaDesc.2: A poorly located section of bad character which is sparsely settled with shack type houses. Any additional building would likewise be of low grade nature.

areaDesc.3: Central location- near employment- good schools and churches
areaDesc.14: Negro concentration along railroad tracks adn on 13th to 15th Streets. Some low class Jewish on 17th and 18th Streets from French to Parade.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation- suburban atmosphere
areaDesc.4: Heavy traffic on Buffalo Pike- low lying land- Proximity to railroad tracks.
areaDesc.14: Development is allayed because of encroachment of undesirable surroundings. 26th, 27th, and 29th Streets are very poor although development is scattered. Housing is concentrated in the first two blocks paralleling the Buffalo Pike, the balance of the area being sparsely settled.

areaDesc.3: Near schools - Homogenous development of good character. Restricted section well-planned with good elevation.
areaDesc.14: Continued building activity may be anticipated in this section - probably the most active of any area in Erie.

areaDesc.3: Desirable residential seciton with good elevation
areaDesc.4: Schools are lacking and children must pay tuition in city schools or commute to county schools.
areaDesc.14: Section is building slowly with fairly good houses.

areaDesc.2: A summer cottage development primarly with some few very good homes interspersed through the area. Some concentration of houses is centered along West Lake Road and West 12th Street. Development will be slow because of the location, although for summer cottages some activity may be anticipated. The vacant ground not presently built on is being farmed. Area is outside the city limits of Erie. Mortgage funds in this area are limited as to type of structure and very little high-class construction of a permanent home nature is anticipated.
An outlying section which has not recieved much enthusiasm. Practically no development has taken place and it is very questionable that any additional housing will be better than third grade.

A section well outside the city limits which was well planned and well laid out. Only three or four houses have been built to date, but the section appears to be of fairly good grade. Development will necessarily be slow because of the distance to the city. Mortgage financing should be conservative.

Level ground which has been surveyed for improve-ments, but which is practically vacant of housing. Its location and general desirability appear to be questionable for any other than third class devlop-ment.

A sparsely settled section with few houses scattered throughout. The majority of the housing is concentrated along 26th Street. The balance of the section, although surveyed, is practically all being farmed at present. Development will be very slow, but of fair character when such happens. Section is outside the city limits of Erie.

areaDesc.3: Near employment and schools- central location
areaDesc.4: Concentration of foreign- congested area- Housing in poor condition
areaDesc.14: Good demand for houses by Italians.

areaDesc.3: Good location - schools, churches and transportation.
areaDesc.14: An old Gernman section well located with the bulk of the property very well held.

areaDesc.2: Although surveyed or development practically no housing has been built at this date. The area is however, the natural place for expansion of the section immediately to the norht. It is reasonable to assume that such development will be of fairly good character.

areaDesc.3: Restricted residential section of fairly new houses of good character. Near park. Good view.

areaDesc.2: An outlying section sparsely settled principally by Italians. The few houses in the section are on fairly large lots affording gardens and small farm activity. The section has never taken hold and any additional development will probably be third grade also.

Located near a new school, the development of this section will undoubtedly be of a nature similar to B-10. At present only scattered housing has been built but the area is well locted to high grade development.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation and schols and churches. Desirable residential section of good character.
areaDesc.14: Considered a high class medium-priced neighborhood which is favorably affected by the adjacent Glen-wood Park section.

areaDesc.2: An isolated section with a few scattered shack type houses. Values are questionable and the area has a poor reputation. Little additional building will come into this area.

Three streets lying close to the railroad tracks below section B-4. Only scattered housing has been built and the area is not looked upon favor-ably for additional developments. Values are indeterminable and slowly declining.

areaDesc.3: Good transportation and schools - Close to an industrial section nearby within walking distance.
areaDesc.14: Favorably affected by proximity to section A-1 and A-2.

areaDesc.3: Desirable restricted residential are of high class homes - good transportation and schools.
areaDesc.14: The majority of the homes are priced under $15,000. Considerable rivalry exists between this section and A-3 and A-4 for choicest development.

areaDesc.3: Good transportaion and schools - restricted secrion of modest character.
areaDesc.14: Poperty values taper off as they recede the lake shore. Lincoln Ave. is a very old street but very desirable with homes up to 40 years of age. One man owns and controls a large percent of the properties in this section. On Maryland, south of Superior Ave. Shenly and Beverly Streets are new modern brick and frame cottages not quite up to the standard of the balance of this section.

areaDesc.3: Central location- lake frontage- convenient to employment- schools and churches
areaDesc.14: One of the first sections of Erie.

areaDesc.3: Close to employment- central location- Good schools and churches
areaDesc.4: Mediocre neighborhood threatened with expansion from the north
areaDesc.14: Section close to business center is going into a boarding house section

areaDesc.3: Near employment. Central location
areaDesc.4: Mediocre neighborhood threatened with slight Negro encroachment from 12th Street
areaDesc.14: 12th Street is almost solid negro with houses in poor condition, although industry dominates the street and values for such use are good.

areaDesc.3: Central location - only good downtown residential section
areaDesc.4: Somewhat old - heavy traffic through section
areaDesc.14: Considerable business of small nature scattered throughout section. Many wealthy people are moving out. Section is very spotty but retains its desirability as a residential area. Many good modern apartments in this section. Graded second grade principally because of location and stable demand for porperty. 6th and 10th were originally developed with very high grade homes which are still in excellent condition.

areaDesc.3: Near employment- central location- near Government property on waterfront.
areaDesc.4: Gas tanks- pest hospital- smoke and noise from industry
areaDesc.14: One of the first sections built in the city. Property east of railroad is the worst in the section

areaDesc.3: Near schools- employment on east side
areaDesc.4: Concentration of low class populace- poorly built houses- many unpaved streets
areaDesc.14: Has never been a good section and market fro housing is limited to foreign.

areaDesc.3: Central location. Near employment- schools- churches.
areaDesc.4: Between two foreign sections of poor character
areaDesc.14: Dunn and Lighthouse Streets are slightly better than the balance of the section.

areaDesc.2: This section is also surveyed for development but only very scattered housing has been built to date. Because of its location there is little possibility of the section ever being improved with better than third grade housing.
Level to rolling in western end.
areaDesc.3: Good transportation - schools - chruches
Nice clean desirable residential section of good character.
Good location - good transportation - only new northeast side residential section - convenient to east side plants - homogenous high class development
areaDesc.14: Properties fronting on the lake are very good.

areaDesc.3: Good location
areaDesc.4: Very mediocre neighborhood of lower class people
areaDesc.14: Low class Jewish coming into western end of section. Foreign encroachment in eastern end.

areaDesc.2: A sparsely built area which is expected to develop into a good section. Located along the lake shore it is one of the few good lake front locations avail-able for high class building. the reputation of the are is fine and developmet will undoubtedly be of high calibre.
Three very poor streets sparsely settled with shack type housing in poor condition. Values are questionable. The land is practically all swamp ground of little value.

areaDesc.3: Near east side employment
areaDesc.4: Railroad tracks- Unpaved streets- low lying ground- heavy traffic on Pike
areaDesc.14: Property on Elm Street is the best. Buffalo highway properties are also fairly good with the balance of the section very mediocre.

areaDesc.3: Desirable residential development of good houses. Near golf course. WEll-planned section.
areaDesc.14: Developed by G.E. for officials of the company. Section is outside city limits of Erie.

areaDesc.2: Although apparently laid out, the section is practically all farmland. Such scattered housing that exists is of only fair character and any additional development will undoubtedly be slow. Expansion of General Electric would probably encourage new building in this section, but such appears remote at this date.

areaDesc.3: Near employment locally. Good transportation- schools- churches
areaDesc.14: This is a very old town depending for growth on G. E. or other industry in the area.

areaDesc.2: Surveyed land now being farmed with only very scattered housing of third grade character

areaDesc.3: Central location. Immediate conversion to semi-business
areaDesc.14: The section is being taken over by doctors and dentists. Many large houses are being converted to apartments and boarding houses. Section enjoys a good reputation and values have held up very well. Some fine old houses are still occupied by original owners.
